Posts.Content: charmainejensenvoisine wrote: Orillia Soldiers' Memorial Hospital (Chemotherapy) is slated to close/transfer to Barrie. This is not in the best interest of those people that live in Orillia and surrounding area. There was a meeting in the evening of Monday July 9th at the hospital with the board of directors, other hospital staff including staff of the clinic and patients who had the opportunity to voice their concerns and opinions and the media... There is a FB (Face Book) group that has been created and the group is nearly up to 2400 members - it would be appreciated to receive as much show of support to keep the clinic open as possible by joining this group - I as a breast cancer survivor am a member of this group and would like to invite you all to also join this group at:- https://www.facebook.com/notifications#!/groups/132446486893465/ Please feel free to pass the link of this group to other forums that you are a member of on this site, to your friends and family members. Thanks you all so very, very much - Charmaine  Dx September 5, 2009 - 49 years old. 2 lumpectomies and sentinel node biopsy, Chemotherapy 4 treatments and 30 RADS 5 BOOSTS, Tamoxifen 5 years. Dx 9/17/2009, ILC/IDC, Right, 3cm, Stage IB, Grade 2, 0/5 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Chemotherapy 12/2/2009 Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxol (paclitaxel), Taxotere (docetaxel) Radiation Therapy 3/5/2010 Breast, Lymph nodes Hormonal Therapy 3/5/2010 Tamoxifen pills (Nolvadex, Apo-Tamox, Tamofen, Tamone) Surgery Lumpectomy: Right; Lymph node removal: Sentinel Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Chemotherapy Treatment Clinic (slated to close/transfer) charmainejensenvoisine charmainejensenvoisine

Posts.Content: charmainejensenvoisine wrote: Hello everyone, I have noticed probably since about a week after fnishing my chemotherapy (February 2) that in the area of my childhood immunization on my upper left thigh (it is sensitive and quite swollen) .  I do not know whether or not to relate this to the chemo drugs/steroids or not?   This has never happened to me.  Has anybody else experienced this? Charmaine Dx September 5, 2009 - 49 years old. 2 lumpectomies and sentinel node biopsy, Chemotherapy 4 treatments and 30 RADS 5 BOOSTS, Tamoxifen 5 years.
